A judge has blocked a New Hampshire law that would add extra steps to the registration process for first time voters as case said McDermott of New Hampshire public radio reports the ruling comes amid concerns that the statute with dampen turnout among certain groups of voters
The law added new language to New Hampshire's voter registration forms an stiff penalties for people who didn't present prove they lived where they were trying to vote
The state Democratic Party and the local chapter of the league of women voters filed suit to block the law last fall arguing that it was too confusing and would drive away legitimate voters they also argue that it was passed under the guise of preventing voter fraud despite a lack of evidence that such fraud is a serious problem
Finding those arguments credible a judge ordered the state to toss the new regulations in favor of the rules he used in twenty six keen it's unclear whether state attorneys plan to appeal that ruling for NPR News I'm Casey McDermott and conquered

A new study finds the number of Americans who died from air pollution drop shortly after the clean Air Act went into effect NPR's Rebecca Hersher reports that tens of thousands of deaths were avoid it every year
After the clean Air Act was passed in Nineteen Ninety power plants and trucks and cars got cleaner in two decades following the X. passage the amount of tiny particulate matter that we all were breathing everyday fell nearly forty percent
And according to a new study as pollution decreased lives were saved scientists found the number of pollution driven deaths each year was cut in half after the clean Air Act was passed because fewer people died of strokes respiratory illness and other conditions exacerbated are caused by pollution
